subsection.name: 3.3 "Web Application" Tutorial
subsection.p: This section shows how to write and a deploy a web application using Cayenne.

subsection.name: 3.2.1 Tutorial Setup
subsection.p: - Follow the steps outlined in Cayenne installation instructions. In particular, JSDK 1.4 must be installed.

- Unpack downloaded tutorial file (cayenne-cmd-app.tar.gz) anywhere in the filesystem. A new directory named cayenne-web-app will be created. This directory is referred to as "project directory" further in this tutorial.
- Copy cayenne.jar to the lib subdirectory of the tutorial project directory.

subsection.name: 3.2.2 Prepare Tutorial Database
subsection.p: Run tutorialdb.sql script located in the project directory to create test tables. This script is tested on MySQL, but it should be easy to port to any other RDBMS. Also note that if you already tried "Command Line Application" tutorial in this chapter, you may already have tables with the same names in your database. In this case you may uncomment "DROP TABLE..." statements in the beginning of this script to recreate tables from scratch.
